main event: A spherical object about 3-4 feet in diameter was spotted hovering over Lakewood, California for about 2 minutes on May 7, 1966 before ascending vertically and disappearing.
interesting points: The object was described as very bright, brighter than a star, with a slight glow in the center.
The object appeared to get smaller as it moved away until it was no longer visible.
Another sighting in Lakewood on January 23, 1965 described multiple bright, pinpoint objects moving steadily from west to east, believed to be man-made devices such as flares.
The witness had experience in aeronautics and engineering, having worked for aircraft companies, but could not provide further details without authorization from their employer.
The sighting was reported to the post office in 1965.
